Of the many options on Blai, this is definitely one of the most economical.  Prices are VERY competitive.  It's cheap, and the food is pretty darned A-OK (hence the three stars!).  I love pintxos, and I love how exciting Blai can be in the evenings.  That said, Tasqueta de Blai is quite popular, and it's almost always filled to the brim.  That means that it might be hard to have a meaningful conversation with your fellow diners/drinkers: the noise level is quite loud, and if you're sitting along the bar, people regularly reach out in front, behind, above, and below you to grab pintxos and drinks.  Indeed, there's a bit of a risk of getting spilled on.  If you can, I recommend finding a table along the other side of the restaurant and then casually (and calmly) perusing the food options and then returning to your seat.Tasqueta de Blai is super cheap, clean, organized, and generally good.  Just be prepared to deal with the masses.
